description: Nonprofit organization providing food pantry and comprehensive services for American citizens and non-citizens of all races, ethnicities, and national origins. Requires detailed documentation and proof of legal status.

name: Atlanta Inner-City Ministry
description: Food pantry providing weekly support bags for families and individuals. Serves seniors 65+ and parents with children under 18. Registration required.

name: Another Chance Atlanta
description: Community organization providing free food distribution on Fridays. Picture ID required along with TLC intake form and USDA/TEFAP household eligibility form.

name: Sol Underground Free Store - Auburn Avenue
description: Mutual aid free store providing clothing, household items, books, and food. No requirements or documentation needed. 1st Friday location outside For Keeps Books.

name: Sol Underground Free Store - MLK Jr Drive
description: Mutual aid free store providing clothing, household items, books, and food. No requirements or documentation needed. 2nd and 4th Friday location outside Catholic Shrine of Immaculate Conception.

name: South Bend Commons
description: Free social space focused on autonomous self-organization providing free grocery distribution in Lakewood Heights. No requirements or documentation needed.

name: New Life Community Alliance
description: Community organization providing food pantry and meals for South DeKalb residents. Photo ID and proof of residency recommended but not strictly required.

name: Intown Food Pantry
description: Food pantry located at Druid Hills Presbyterian Church serving over 300 households weekly. Photo ID requested but no legal status proof needed. Serves Intown Atlanta neighborhoods.

name: Community Church Atlanta
description: Community Marketplace food pantry at Vicars Community Center addressing food insecurity on Atlanta's west side. Photo ID requested. Open to all during posted hours.

name: Salem Bible Church
description: Church food pantry through Social Services Ministry and Sunshine Brotherhood Community Center, distributing over 30,000 pounds of food weekly. Photo ID and proof of residency requested.
hours: Tuesday, Thursday: 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM (2nd and 4th Thursday)

name: Toco Hills Community Alliance
description: Food pantry serving North Central DeKalb County residents, individuals experiencing homelessness, and veterans. Registration starts at 12 PM.

name: New Beginnings Food Outreach
description: Food pantry serving multiple metro Atlanta counties. New clients must bring valid ID, proof of income for household members, and proof of residence.

name: Fellowship of Faith Church International
description: Food pantry in East Point serving multiple metro Atlanta counties. Picture ID and proof of residence required; does not require proof of legal status.

name: Atlanta Justice Alliance - Woodruff Park
description: Grassroots mutual aid organization providing free food distribution at Woodruff Park in downtown Atlanta. No requirements, proof, or documentation needed. Open to all, especially serving homeless community.

name: Food4Life - Edgewood Distribution
description: Atlanta Survival Program providing free groceries at the corner of Mayson Avenue and Hardee Street in Edgewood. No requirements or documentation needed. Welcome to all.

name: Duluth Cooperative Ministry
description: Cooperative ministry providing food assistance and support services to Duluth area families. Serves zip codes 30096 and 30097. Contact for appointment.
hours: Monday, Wednesday, Friday: 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM (by appointment)

name: Lilburn Cooperative Ministry
description: Cooperative ministry serving Gwinnett County residents with food pantry services through Kay's Pantry. Requires appointment and standard identification. Zip codes 30087 and 30084.
hours: Monday, Wednesday, Friday: 10:00 AM - 1:30 PM (by appointment)

name: Southeast Gwinnett Cooperative Ministry
description: Cooperative ministry providing food security to families in Southeast Gwinnett. Serves zip codes 30078, 30039, 30017, 30052. Proof of address required. Requires social security card and/or proof of legal status.
hours: Monday: 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM, Wednesday, Friday: 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

name: Buford Family Community Center
description: Community center operated by Buford Family Seventh-day Adventist Church providing food, clothing and classes. ID required. Requires application.

name: Hope and Life Compassion Ministry
description: Multi-ethnic, inclusive church-based food bank serving Gwinnett County. Call for details on food bank services.

name: North Gwinnett Cooperative Ministry
description: Cooperative ministry serving Buford, Sugar Hill, Suwanee and portions of Auburn, Bethlehem, Braselton and Hoschton. Zip codes 30024, 30518, 30519. Proof of residence and ID required, social security card required, does not need proof of legal status.
hours: Monday: 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM, Wednesday, Friday: 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM

name: Vision Academy Life Center
description: Community center providing food pantry services. ID required, does not need proof of legal status. By appointment only.

name: The Pantry at Hamilton Mill
description: Large food pantry serving Gwinnett County and all Georgia residents. Distributes over 35,000 pounds of food weekly, feeding average of 700 families. Photo ID required. No eligibility requirements, all are welcome.

name: StreetWise GA
description: Food pantry serving Gwinnett County by appointment only. Monday, Tuesday, Thursday appointments 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM. Alternative evening hours every other Thursday 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM for working clients.
hours: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday: 10:00 AM - 1:30 PM (by appointment)

name: CarePointe at Cross Pointe Church
description: Community ministry providing food and clothing pantry. Good resource for Spanish-speakers with ESL courses. Valid photo ID and proof of address required.

name: Overcomers House
description: Non-profit social service center providing drive-thru food pantry and senior food box delivery program for homebound residents 60 or older in Gwinnett County.

name: St. Vincent de Paul - Chamblee Tucker
description: Food pantry and food recovery distribution providing financial, material, educational and spiritual support to those in need regardless of background or faith.

name: McEachern Memorial UMC
description: Church food pantry serving food insecure families in Powder Springs 30127 or Marietta 30064. Call outreach office to schedule appointment. Third Wednesday of every month.

name: Lakeview Seventh Day Adventist Church
description: West Cobb church providing hot food and pantry items. Mobile drive-thru pantry most Thursdays and bi-monthly Sunday distribution. Call to verify schedule.

name: Christian Aid Mission Partnership (C.A.M.P.)
description: Food pantry serving Austell, Clarkdale, East Douglas County, Lithia Springs, Mableton, and Powder Springs. Requires social security card or birth certificate but not proof of legal status.

name: The Center for Family Resources
description: Family Cupboard Choice Pantry offering canned goods, protein, fresh meat and produce, diapers and personal hygiene items. Serves families experiencing or at risk of homelessness. Requires social security or birth certificate, eviction notice, utility cut-off notice, and proof of legal status.

name: Cobb Vineyard Church
description: Church food pantry open first and third Saturday of every month. Sign-in begins at 9 AM, ends at 1 PM. First come first serve, open to anyone in need. Need identification or CVC scan card.

name: Family Life Restoration Center
description: Non-profit dedicated to family restoration providing food pantry. Serves Cobb and Fulton counties. Social security card or birth certificate required for household members.

name: Turner Chapel AME
description: Church food pantry and CSFP Senior Food Distribution Program for people 59+. ID and proof of residence required. Serves Cobb County and Georgia residents.
hours: Wednesday: 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

name: Reflections of Trinity - Team 58
description: Division of Reflections of Trinity offering free boxes of groceries. Started in 2012, serves Cobb County families. Partnership with Tapp Middle School pantry.

name: Papa's Pantry - Encompass Ministries
description: Founded in 1998 as Papa's Pantry, renamed Encompass Ministries in 2019. Provides food pantry and grocery assistance. Serves Cherokee, Cobb, Bartow, North Fulton, and Pickens Counties. Reservations preferred.
hours: Monday, Friday: 9:30 AM - 2:30 PM, Tuesday-Thursday: 9:30 AM - 4:30 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM (appointment only for grocery assistance)

name: Never Alone Community Food Pantry
description: Food pantry serving Cherokee, Cobb, Bartow, and Pickens counties. Partners with churches and organizations for remote distributions including Hasty Elementary in Canton. By appointment only.
hours: Monday, Wednesday, Thursday: 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM, 2nd Thursday: 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM, 3rd Saturday: 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM

name: Helping Hands of Paulding County
description: Non-profit assisting Paulding County residents with food pantry and support services. Requires current utility bill and social security card. Proof of legal status required.

name: Malachi's Storehouse at St. Patrick's Church
description: Emergency food pantry at St. Patrick's Episcopal Church addressing food insecurity in metro Atlanta. Provides hot lunch and free groceries. Photo ID recommended for household count. Open every Tuesday except Thanksgiving and Christmas weeks.

name: Providence Community Baptist Church - Daily Bread Ministry
description: Daily Bread Ministry operating for over 30 years, providing food and clothing distribution. Serves Cobb County residents. Photo ID and household birthdates required.
hours: Wednesday: 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM, 3rd Saturday: 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM

name: Schaffer Road Church of Christ
description: Food pantry serving Cobb, Douglas, and Paulding counties. Photo ID or driver's license required. Provides food assistance to individuals and families in need including children, adults, and senior citizens with limited or no income.

name: Wright Street Baptist Church
description: Monthly food pantry serving Cobb County residents. Open the 3rd Saturday of every month. Call ahead to confirm hours and requirements.

name: Shiloh Seventh-Day Adventist Church
description: Church Street Food Pantry operates through the Community Resource Center. Partners with Atlanta Community Food Bank to provide free food to South Cobb area residents in need.
hours: 2nd & 4th Tuesday: 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM, 2nd & 4th Wednesday: 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM

name: Pleasant Grove Missionary Baptist Church - Grove Cares
description: Grove Cares ministry offers periodic drive-thru grocery distributions throughout the year. Serves Cobb, Douglas, and Paulding counties. Text THEGROVEATL to 470-466-8552 for distribution dates notification. No appointment needed.
hours: Periodic distributions - text THEGROVEATL to 470-466-8552 for dates

name: Hollydale United Methodist Church
description: Community food pantry serving Cobb, Douglas, and Paulding counties. Spanish-speaking services available (Hablamos Espa√±ol). Open to anyone with need in the community.
hours: Monday: 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM

name: St. Catherine of Siena Catholic Church - St. Vincent de Paul
description: Saint Vincent de Paul food pantry providing week's worth of bagged non-perishable food and frozen meat once monthly to Kennesaw area households. Also provides paper products, diapers, and feminine products. By appointment only.

name: Acworth Emergency Food Pantry - Mars Hill Presbyterian Church
description: Emergency food pantry operated by Mars Hill Presbyterian Church. By appointment only on Tuesdays and Fridays. Call to schedule appointment - if no answer, leave a message and a volunteer will return your call.

name: Bascomb Mission Thrift Food Pantry
description: Thrift store and food pantry serving Cherokee County. No documentation required. Open Wednesday through Saturday for food assistance.
hours: Wednesday-Friday: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

name: Timothy's Cupboard - Timothy Lutheran Church
description: Food ministry operating since October 1991 serving Cherokee, Bartow, and Cobb counties. By appointment only on Tuesdays. Call ahead to schedule.

name: St. Michael the Archangel Catholic Church Food Pantry
description: Food pantry serving Cherokee County residents in need. First come, first served basis with no appointment necessary. Located at top of hill past playground. Signage posted in parking lot.

name: Acworth United Methodist Church
description: Drive-through food pantry serving 160 families weekly and distributing almost 100,000 pounds of food annually. Open every Tuesday afternoon for drive-through pickup.

name: Jay Weaver Emergency Food Pantry - Heritage Presbyterian Church
description: Emergency food pantry serving limited area within five miles of church location. For food pantry inquiries, call and dial extension 212.
hours: Call (770) 926-3558 ext. 212 for hours and eligibility

name: MUST Ministries Cherokee
description: MUST Ministries Cherokee County location offering food, clothing, employment services, and breads & sweets. Donations accepted Monday-Friday 8 AM - 2 PM.

name: Dominic's Mission
description: Community food kitchen offering free food, clothing, hygiene items, baby essentials, and meal vouchers. Located next to Rife Repurposing. Open Saturdays.

name: CAYA Reconciliation Ministries
description: Come As You Are Reconciliation Ministries food pantry serving Dallas and surrounding Paulding County communities. Each family may receive food assistance once per month.

name: Northwest Christian Church
description: Community food bank partnered with Atlanta Community Food Bank providing thousands of pounds of food monthly to hundreds of people. Proof of income and photo ID required. Located between Kennesaw and Acworth on Dallas Acworth Highway.

name: Faith Family Church
description: Assemblies of God church operating food pantry serving Cherokee County. Documents required: photo ID, Social Security proof, and proof of residence. Open Monday and Thursday mornings.

name: Forever Fed
description: Mobile ministry hosting seven outdoor drive-thru food pantries monthly at various locations throughout Cherokee and Cobb Counties. Call or visit website for current schedule and locations.
hours: Monthly drive-thru events - check website for schedule

name: House of Hope North Georgia
description: Food bank ministry under Blessed Hope Baptist Church serving Cherokee County. Additional programs include clothes closet, smoke detector installation, car seat surplus, and satellite food pantries. Volunteer opportunities available Tuesday and Thursday mornings.

name: Encompass Ministries
description: Client-choice food pantry serving Cherokee, Cobb, Bartow, North Fulton, and Pickens Counties. Provides week's worth of groceries to individuals and families once every 3 months. By appointment only.

name: Greater Community Church Of God In Christ
description: Food pantry serving Cobb County.

name: First Christian Church
description: Food pantry serving Cobb County.

name: Northwest Christian Church
description: Food pantry serving Cherokee County. Bring identification.

name: Canton First Baptist
description: Food pantry serving canned and dry goods.

description: Food pantry serving Henry County residents. Call ahead to confirm hours.

name: Locust Grove United Methodist Church
description: Food pantry serving the Locust Grove community.

name: Helping in His Name Ministries
description: Ecumenical nonprofit providing emergency assistance to unemployed, underemployed, elderly, and single parents in Henry County. By appointment only.
hours: Monday, Wednesday, Friday: 9:00 AM - 11:30 AM, Tuesday: 5:30 PM - 6:30 PM, Thursday: 4:30 PM - 5:30 PM (by appointment only)

name: Ambassador Life Center
description: Non-profit food pantry helping fight hunger in the Stockbridge community.

name: Good Samaritan Center
description: Faith-based organization offering food and emergency financial aid to Douglas County citizens in need since 1983. Photo ID required.
hours: Monday - Thursday: 9:00 AM - 12:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM - 11:30 AM

name: Sweetwater Mission
description: Full-service client choice food pantry providing nutritious foods including meat and fresh produce. Photo ID and proof of residence required.

name: Columbia Drive United Methodist Church
description: Food pantry serving DeKalb County residents in zip codes 30032, 30033, 30034, 30035. Requires documentation.

name: Food4Life - Clarkston Distribution
address: Corner of East Ponce de Leon and Brockett Roads
description: Atlanta Survival Program providing free groceries at Clarkston distribution site. No requirements or documentation needed. Welcome to all.

name: Clifton United Methodist Church
description: Food pantry serving zip codes 30032, 30034, 30316. Proof of income required. Open 3rd Wednesday of each month.

name: World Changers Church International
description: Food pantry serving multiple metro Atlanta counties. Proof of residence, picture ID, and birth certificates for children under 18 required.

name: Friendship Community Church
description: Food pantry serving multiple metro Atlanta counties including Fulton, Clayton, Cobb, DeKalb, Gwinnett, Henry, Paulding, and Rockdale.

name: Lighthouse Food Pantry
description: Food pantry serving Paulding County. Arrive by 11:45 AM at the latest to receive food.

name: All Nations Life and Praise Church
description: Food pantry helping fight hunger in the Stockbridge community.

name: Hillside Presbyterian Church
description: Food pantry services available at Hillside Presbyterian Church serving the Decatur community.

hours: Mon‚ÄìWed & Fri: 9:00 AM ‚Äì 5:00 PM (distribution schedules vary)

description: Church that hosts community food distributions/food-bank events.
hours: Events scheduled as announced; check church site or call
